document_title: Single kidney cyst: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
In some cases of complications, simple kidney cysts cause conditions such as:
Kidney cyst size is too large, pressing on bones or other internal organs, causing pain or discomfort; Obstruction of the flow of blood or urine through the kidneys or ureters; Inside the kidney cyst is clear fluid. If it bursts, it will cause infection, fever, and pain.; Renal cysts rupture, causing pain or causing hematuria and urinary diseases.; High blood pressure, affecting the heart.
